Package
Description
com.google.mu.collect
A few useful collections

  • Uses of Selection in com.google.mu.collect

    Methods in com.google.mu.collect that return Selection
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static <T> Selection<T>
    Selection.all()
    Returns an unlimited selection of all (unspecified) choices.
    Selection<T>
    Selection.intersect(Selection<T> that)
    Returns an intersection of this selection and that.
    Selection<T>
    Selection.intersect(Set<? extends T> set)
    Returns an intersection of this selection and the elements from set.
    static <T> Selection<T>
    Selection.none()
    Returns an empty selection.
    static <T> Selection<T>
    Selection.nonEmptyOrAll(Collection<? extends T> choices)
    Converts to Selection from legacy code where an empty collection means all.
    static <T> Selection<T>
    Selection.only(T... choices)
    Returns a selection of choices.
    Selection<String>
    Selection.Parser.parse(String string)
    Parses string into a Selection of strings by treating the single '*' character as all().
    <T, E extends Throwable>
    Selection<T>
    Selection.Parser.parse(String string, CheckedFunction<String, ? extends T, E> elementParser)
    Parses string into a Selection by treating the single '*' character as all(), and delegating to elementParser to parse each explicit selection element.
    Selection<T>
    Selection.union(Selection<T> that)
    Returns an union of this selection and that.
    Selection<T>
    Selection.union(Set<? extends T> set)
    Returns a union of this selection and the elements from set.

    Description
    static <T> Collector<Selection<T>, ?, Selection<T>>
    Selection.toIntersection()

    Returns a collector that intersects the input selections.
    static <T> Collector<T, ?, Selection<T>>
    Selection.toSelection()
    Returns a collector that collects input elements into a limited selection.
    static <T> Collector<Selection<T>, ?, Selection<T>>

    Returns a collector that unions the input selections.
    static <T> Collector<Selection<T>, ?, Selection<T>>

    Returns a collector that unions the input selections.
